content: Securities Equities Stocks Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 23 Mar 2019Anyone taken a look at pinterest financials from their filing to go public?Things to note?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardAnswered on 23 Apr 2019Ah, that platform that people go to to create things like wedding mood boards. Here are some interesting facts from Pinterest's (Ticker: PINS) financials: For year ended Dec 31. 2018: Revenue of $755.9 million up from $472.8 million in 2017265 million monthly active users (MAUs) as of late last year, bringing in some $700 million in ad revenue in 2018Doubled its MAU count since early 2016, hitting 265 million late last yearPinterest's largest group of MAUs came from outside the U.S., with about 184 million (compared with 82 million in the U.S.)That said, U.S. users generate far more revenue for the companyGlobal average revenue per user (ARPU) in the year ended December 31, 2018 was $3.14, up 25 percent YoYU.S. ARPU was at $9.04, a 47 percent increase YoYNet loss shrank to $62.9 million last year from $130 million in 2017Capital raised: Raised around $1.5 billion from VCsKey stakeholders include Bessemer Venture Partners, FirstMark Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, Fidelity and Valiant Capital Partners0 comments3
